automation_productivity.reasoning: Agent Mode automatically finds context, runs commands, and iterates on errors, dramatically reducing manual coding work [1].

beginner_friendly_onboarding.reasoning: A free tier, straightforward installation, and clear docs make it approachable for new users even though it targets developers [2][3].

code_quality_testing.reasoning: Cursor can generate tests and execute them in the integrated terminal, looping to fix failing cases to help maintain quality [4].

codebase_comprehension.reasoning: @ references and custom retrieval pull relevant files and symbols so the assistant can answer questions about a repository [1][5].

creative_multimodal_exploration.reasoning: Prompts can include images and web search results, enabling some multimodal exploration while remaining code-centric [6].

data_experimental_flexibility.reasoning: The editor relies on the user's environment for data access and offers no built-in experiment tracking or datasets [7].

visual_no_code_development.reasoning: Cursor is a code-first IDE without drag-and-drop or visual builders for no-code development [2].

workflow_agent_orchestration.reasoning: Agent Mode handles multi-step tasks and runs commands but operates as a single assistant rather than coordinating multiple agents [1].
